description:
Aspergillus eucalypticola CBS 122712 is a species of filamentous fungus belonging to the genus Aspergillus. It was first isolated from soil collected in a Eucalyptus forest in Australia.

Morphologically, A. eucalypticola CBS 122712 produces conidiophores with globose to subglobose vesicles and uniseriate phialides. The conidia are globose to subglobose in shape, smooth-walled, and greenish-gray in color.

Phylogenetically, A. eucalypticola is closely related to other Aspergillus species within the section Fumigati, based on analyses of molecular markers such as the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region and Î²-tubulin gene sequences.

This species is of interest due to its potential to produce secondary metabolites and its possible ecological role in the Eucalyptus-associated soil environment. Further research is needed to fully characterize its biological and functional properties.
